title: Puerto Rico Training Exercise March 15, 2024 (United States Marine Corps)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Puerto Rico Training Exercise March 15, 2024 (United States Marine Corps)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that Puerto Rico National Guard participated in joint exercises with Army and Marine groups that took place on or about March 15, 2024 https://www.nationalguard.mil/News/Article-View/Article/3724579/puerto-rico-guard-partners-with-sister-services-in-joint-exercise/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any communications, emails, text messages, and attachments exchanged between your department and other military departments involved in the training exercise (including but not limited to: US Army, Marines, US Navy, US Army Reserve).

2) Any communications, emails, text messages, and attachments exchanged between your department and Puerto Rican government agencies who had knowledge of the training exercise (including but not limited to: Puerto Rico Police Department and Office of the Governor (La Fortaleza)).

3) Any presentations, presentation attachments, and instructional materials (these include but are not limited to audio, video, PowerPoint presentations, and slide formats) concerning the training exercise that took place in Puerto Rico on or about March 15, 2024

4) Any maps used in the planning of and during the training exercise that took place in Puerto Rico on or about March 15, 2024.

This request is for all records produced between January 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being used for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents obtained by this request will be used in the course of reporting on military exercises in Puerto Rico

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

SecureRelease™ Support (Contractor) 
securereleasepublicsupport@deloitte.com  Do NOT respond to this email. The SecureRelease™ Support desk is not operated by a FOIA Office or Agency personnel, and does not process requests--please do not send request details, supporting documentation, or other sensitive information to this inbox. Additionally, please note that SecureRelease™ Support is unable to provide updates concerning the processing, status, or timeline of requests, nor can we offer guidance with regard to agency procedures. For these inquiries, please contact the Agency or refer to their website.

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona counties (Pima County Elections Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documentation detailing the cost of elections by polling location or polling center, dated between 2019 and the present. 

Ultimately, my goal is to understand how much money is saved or spent altering the number of polling locations. If there is a better way to request this information, I'm all ears.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Uchill

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: R002838-041023 - Full Response Notice
communications.communication:
Dear Joseph Uchill, 
 
We received a public information request from you on April 10, 2023. Your request mentioned: 
 
“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

Documentation detailing the cost of elections by polling location or polling center, dated between 2019 and the present. 

Ultimately, my goal is to understand how much money is saved or spent altering the number of polling locations. If there is a better way to request this information, I'm all ears. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Joseph Uchill” 
 
Your response has been completed. You can access the released documents on your account at 
https://pimacountyaz.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/CustomerHome.aspx 
 PLEASE NOTE: You will have thirty (30) days to download records responsive to your request. 
 
If you have any questions, please reply to this email. Thank you for your attention. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
Clerk of the Board 
520-724-8449 
 
To view the full details of this request please log into the Public Records System. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlLOzuoW7P1Jnt4Obk1yVz-2FSpOubflPxcGDGnCsppMMQT9QHphabGodURcr3O1hSHyrF9ufzfb4Z3hJ9LFqpuQuI-3D--yN_6DU5j9ZBga8JdADvQEzHkfeHElXumux5IsJvVJ2uvlBEWl1HyI8GyDl6eBVGKZ6vewUIQ8g9xZ-2FO6wDy9f-2F-2FUI8A1AVvGOHaFKaZ2AwEMJ2bMCca8oof7A4i2oe0Awjdzgss0Im-2FWcuJMT-2F8j1yLuE23BxMVwofiL0rO4ljeE5tqEIIcdcqBtS67e-2Brb1u3yabLjE5scVeqBKW9Fon-2BtXD4lGlcBvDNaoxaHs6TRM-2FVPBButN1fiyk9NHWGQ9eH9kbYe14Y-2B7CeTcaDDm1VRWStH8uA6IAjV6-2FbsUuAhA-2B7ijr4MHIqa-2FE8PM61Wmn70L3kB40kMrvKQTLwY6ybbNsgTAcBPdZ96AE-2Fc-2BnhBqMAO3j5uWz9P6Q6GzAhhLLBk)

title: WSP internal investigations of Chong Yim #78

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: WSP internal investigations of Chong Yim #78
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every WSP internal investigative file in which Chong Yim #78 was a named officer at any point in the investigation, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R007100-053023
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Washington State Patrol. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Revised Code of Washington, RCW 42.56. Your request was received in this office on 5/30/2023 and given the reference number R007100-053023 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The full and complete content of every WSP internal investigative file in which Chong Yim #78 was a named officer at any point in the investigation, along with associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fwashington-state-patrol-211%252Fwsp-internal-investigations-of-chong-yim-78-146549%252F%253Femail%253Dpubrecs%252540wsp.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAawHapt0XKE6ZBQMyv_eeI3Ek%3A1q4CdZ%3A9D0-CuthPEGj3mlgb1C88XFsc37Jx0cmbeDiFV7937E 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant Washington State Patrol department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Washington Public Records Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 

You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Washington State Patrol

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Records Request of May 30, 2023, Reference # R007100-053023 Dear Rose Terse, The Washington State Patrol is continuing to work on your records request for the following: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

The full and complete content of every WSP internal investigative file in which Chong Yim #78 was a named officer at any point in the investigation, along with associated metadata. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fwashington-state-patrol-211%252Fwsp-internal-investigations-of-chong-yim-78-146549%252F%253Femail%253Dpubrecs%252540wsp.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAawHapt0XKE6ZBQMyv_eeI3Ek%3A1q4CdZ%3A9D0-CuthPEGj3mlgb1C88XFsc37Jx0cmbeDiFV7937E” Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, this is notification that we are searching our records to determine the location, nature, and amount of records, if any, that may be responsive to your request.  Additional time is required due to the current amount of records requests, the volume of potentially responsive records, and to prepare records for dissemination without causing disruption to the essential functions of the agency (RCW 42.56.100). If responsive records are found we estimate that we can make available an installment of records on or before 5/7/24.  If records are ready prior to that time, you will be notified.  If the time assessment requires adjustment, you will also be notified. Should you have any questions, please let us know. Should you have any questions, please let us know. 
Sincerely, Anna Yim Public Records Coordinator

title: Agency Roster (Maricopa County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Maricopa County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Maricopa County Sheriff) 1954
communications.communication:
Good morning,



The Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office has received your request for public records and is processing your request. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received, and no requests are prioritized by deadline date. The amount of time to completely process your request depends upon the number of pending requests, volume of material encompassed in the request, and the amount of redaction, if any, that is necessary.



Please be aware, if you are requesting records with large amount of body camera videos and or high-profile cases, the time to complete your request may be significantly longer as these cases are often voluminous. Identifying the specific record(s) being requested may help expedite your request. You will be notified once records are made available for you to download or pick up, or if no records are found. Your tracking # is 1954. When checking the status of your request, please send emails to mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov<mailto:mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov> and include your tracking #1954.

Thank you,
Sgt. Monica Bretado
Media Relations
[cid:image001.jpg@01DA6E39.77CBFF20]<https://twitter.com/mcsoaz?lang=en>[facebook-icon_32x32]<https://www.facebook.com/MCSOaz>   [cid:image003.png@01DA6E39.77CBFF20] <https://www.mcso.org/> [instagram] <https://www.instagram.com/mcsoaz/?hl=en> [Facebook] <https://www.facebook.com/mcsoazespanol/>  [cid:image001.jpg@01DA6E39.77CBFF20] <https://twitter.com/mcsoazespanol>
[cid:image006.jpg@01DA6E39.77CBFF20]
The information contained in this email and any files transmitted with it are confidential and/or privileged, and are intended solely for the use of the recipients listed above. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution, or copying of the transmitted information is strictly prohibited. If you have received this transmission in error, please immediately notify the sender and delete and destroy all copies and attachments.

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster (Maricopa County Sheriff) 1954 Complete
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your records are available and can be downloaded HERE<https://mcso.sharefile.com/d-sd78c19938948410b9cfe7161f4022681> for free for the next ten (10) business days. Once you click on the link you will need to input your name and email address to access the records. The link will automatically expire in 10 business days and files are deleted. If you fail to download these files, you will need to resubmit a new request to obtain copies. If you would like a hard copy, please respond to this email and an appointment will be set up for purchasing.

Below is the process and fee associated with requesting hard copies.

Hard copies will be available only by appointments only. Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m., excluding holidays.  Your records will be available for review or purchase for the next 30 business days from the date of this notice. A price will be provided if you choose to receive hard copies.

Your records can be picked up at the Sheriff’s Office headquarters at 550 W. Jackson, Phoenix AZ 85003. By appointment only.

Date of release: 0604/2024
Subject of your request:  Documents relating to the current MCSO staff roster
Items released:
•            Current MCSO Staff Roster of sworn employees

The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD’s:                                      $15.00 each

*Please Note: Documents are available for 30 business days from the date of this notice to be picked up and/or reviewed.  After 30 business days has elapsed, the request will be closed, and the documents destroyed.  In order to obtain requested documents after the 30 business days, a new public records request will have to be resubmitted and reprocessed.  All requests are handled in the order they are received. Providing this response will close out this request. Thank you

title: ICF conflict-of-interest statements

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ICF conflict-of-interest statements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents (statements, applications, forms, etc) related to the disclosure of organizational or personal conflicts-of-interest that consulting firm ICF submitted in association with contracts it was awarded between January 1, 2020, and the date the search is conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Madeleine Stone

communications.subject: FOIA #GFO-2024-01672-F Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Good morning Ms. Stone,

You should be receiving a notification from HQ DOE informing you that your FOIA request was transferred to the Golden Field Office (GFO).  Reference HQ-2024-01413-F.  This is to acknowledge receipt of your request (attached) which has been re-assigned docket number GFO-2024-01672-F.

***Please pay particular attention to the "Willingness to Pay Fees" section of the letter.  Please provide an exact amount that you are willing to pay.  If the processing costs are higher than the amount you are willing to pay, we will give you the opportunity to modify, clarify, or cancel your request.  Your request will temporarily be placed on hold until the fee issue is resolved.

We have tasked the appropriate office with conducting a search for records responsive to your request and will keep you informed of our status.  In the meantime, let me know if you have any questions/concerns or if I can be of any additional assistance.
Thanks!
V/r
Dan


Daniel J. Dial
Government Information Specialist
Freedom of Information Act & Privacy Officer
Records Management Field Official
Office of Chief Counsel
U.S. Department of Energy, Golden Field Office
15013 Denver West Parkway
Golden, CO 80401

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Number of vacancies

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman, Number of vacancies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

List of everyone who has left the Sheriff's department since March 3, 2024. This would be from March 3 to today, May 28th. 2024. This is to include the letter of resignation, or firings, plus exit letters. This is to include retirements, firings, and those who quit. Thank you

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 
List of everyone who has left the Sheriff's department since March 3, 2024. This would be from March 3 to today, May 28th. 2024. This is to include the letter of resignation, or firings, plus exit letters. This is to include retirements, firings, and those who quit. Thank you 
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. title: Civilian Employees of SPD Records Request

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Civilian Employees of SPD Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Staff roster of civilian employees of SPD including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: OpenDocument spreadsheet, plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

2) Security footages of surveillance cameras within the Spokane County Jail from the dates 05/21/2022 to 05/23/2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anon Koo

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1) Staff roster of civilian employees of SPD including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: OpenDocument spreadsheet, plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

--- Please respond above this line --- 
If you wish to submit a response, update an existing request, check the status of an already submitted request, or submit a new public records request, please do so by replying to this notification or go through your “My Request Center” account on the City’s public records request portal (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSVD4CrS9uFW2stupoI-2F3P-2FCR9v4w4dDGSabyWOuZGyK73EIPwhayp6yerTiw-2FMwyAatRlrvnO7ENj4b1rLl3GE-3DFnbB_1Ig-2BpJsKvkUdysGV9G-2BM0eLbdvEsmJRPipKD5exgT9AGMhd1d7kmuSGell2ZSH29SbLRWcrA6PQsPX26VHIIqFyjjsckTUiNBhYVLUOhGGjzdeOO341AL91-2BPvm0lB5r08yoQRQXuIRdNqq51Dkjzd6LtkH9-2BSUQAifCQSDAwyixHKX-2B034djKUwo0hsx1JmwqR2DrOctuMqSlHmpSAZC8LbnYLRXqX2rho3hznWRCGcJ1QBNJ8FxLZmSdpnZwze3H95Gve-2Fhqh09vhaJwR-2FQv-2BX0Oyyb29qyVoh2wRSheFDuLf-2F8Zy8au0YCet7JQmBu5UJiimxCv9YWIuBMmPfu3S-2BACrc6LLukNgJH6-2FhuR1xNUismVZNBb0VtUAZloPqawEH3UsassLLo3jK8cQH8g-3D-3D) 
Good afternoon: 
This is a follow up to my November 22, 2023, correspondence to you regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P012066-111423.  Due to other workload and staff schedules and absences, some additional time is needed for your request.  We anticipate responsive records will be available on or about January 26, 2024, and we will follow up with you accordingly. 
The records you seek include a list of individuals.  An appellate court decision, SEIU Healthcare 775 NW v. DSHS, 193 Wn. App. 377 (2016), holds that when a city receives a request for documents that includes a list of individuals, the City is required to determine whether the list will be used for “commercial purposes.” The case concluded that a requestor has a commercial purpose if the requestor intends to use the list for direct or indirect profit-making activity, regardless of whether the requestor intends to contact the individuals on the list or even if the individuals are personally affected by the release of the list or not. If the City has some indication that a requester intends to use a list of individuals for a commercial purpose, we are required to “investigate further” before we disclose that list. 

Further, the SEIU case held that even an affirmation stating that any responsive records received for a request which include lists of individuals will not be used for commercial purposes, is not sufficient.  Instead, before we can release the records providing City salary information, we are required to obtain from you sufficient details as to what you intend to use the list for so that we can make an independent evaluation as to whether or not your purpose is commercial or not. 

Please fill out and return the attached Commercial Purpose Declaration. A determination will then be made as to whether your stated purpose regarding the use of the list(s) of individuals contained in any compiled responsive records is sufficient to allow for the release of this information. To avoid unnecessary delay in obtaining these specific responsive records for your request, please return the completed declaration at your earliest opportunity. We will follow up with you within five business days as to the validity of the stated purpose relating to your request. 
Please complete and return the Commercial Purpose Declaration within 30 days of today's date, or by February 8, 2024.  If a completed declaration determined to be valid is not received in the City Clerk's Office by that date, your request will be considered concluded and closed, and a new request will be required in this matter after February 8. 
As I advised above, we anticipate responsive records will be available on or about January 26, 2024, contingent upon the receipt of a completed declaration determined to be valid to show that records provided under this request containing lists of individuals will not be used for commercial purposes. 
Sincerely, 
Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

Accordingly, this is to inform you that a responsive report generated by staff from the City's IT Department is available by accessing your account via the My Request Center. 
Does this document satisfy the intent of your request?  If it does not and you are seeking additional records from the City, please clarify your request by clearly describing what the remaining identifiable public records are, if any, that you may still be attempting to seek, and we will be glad to look into your request further. 
Please provide any such clarification within 30 days of today's date, or by March 11, 2024.  If no clarification is received from you by that date, your request will be considered concluded and closed, and a new request will be required in this matter after March 11. 
Sincerely,

Spokane Deputy City Clerk

communications.subject: [Records Center] City Records Request :: P012066-111423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
If you wish to submit a response, update an existing request, check the status of an already submitted request, or submit a new public records request, please do so by replying to this notification or go through your “My Request Center” account on the City’s public records request portal 
Good afternoon: 
This is a follow up to my February 8 correspondence to you wherein I sought clarification regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P012066-111423. 

City Clerk staff processed your request by sending it to department(s) identified by you as the requestor and/or City staff as potentially possessing responsive records.  Records searches of departmental files were conducted to identify responsive records.  Responsive records were then reviewed for possible exempt information. 

My February 8 correspondence sought clarification from you as to whether you were still seeking any records from the City of Spokane, with any such clarification to be received in the City Clerk's Office by March 11, 2024.  Because no clarification was received from you by that date, your request now closed.  See RCW 42/52.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).  All located responsive records have been provided. 

Now that your request is closed, the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address the request. 

If you have any questions about this request, please contact City Clerk’s Office within 10 business days of the date of this message.  See WAC 44-14-04006(1); Cousins v. State, No. 101769-3, 2024 WL 1562882 (Wash. Apr. 11, 2024). 

If we can be of further assistance, please advise. 

Sincerely, 

Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

title: Police Data Collection Request (2022)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.	the total number of use of force incidents in 2022.

2.	the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force, in 2022 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2022, baton incidents in 2022, etc.)

3.	the total number of civilian complaints against law enforcement that were reported and the total number sustained for 2022.

4.	the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained for 2022.

5.	the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained for 2022.

6.	the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained for 2022.

7.	the total number of officer-involved shootings in 2022, both fatal and non-fatal.

8.	the total number of people who police used force against, broken down by race/ethnicity, in 2022.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Dear Samuel Sinyangwe 
This letter will serve as acknowledgement we are in receipt of the above identified request for records. Be advised additional time will be needed: 
to locate and assemble the information requested; 
to notify any third persons or agencies affected by the request; and 
to determine whether any of the information requested is exempt and a denial should be made as to all or part of the request 
Due to current staffing and volume of requests received by Spokane Police Division, we estimate forwarding you the first installment of responsive records, or a response as to why these records are exempt from inspection per state statutes, in approximately 40 days or September 19, 2023. 
If we are able to provide you with the records or a response sooner than the anticipated date, we will do so without delay. 
Badge ID 1155 / 1249 
Public Records Specialist 
Spokane Police Department

Good afternoon: 
This is a follow up to the August 10 correspondence sent you by staff from the Spokane Police Department regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P008573-081023. 
Due to other workload and staff schedules, additional time is needed for your request.  We anticipate an installment may be available in approximately 35 days, or on or about October 24, 2023, and we will follow up with you accordingly.  If responsive records become available in advance of that date, we will let you know.  Likewise, if additional time is needed, we will advise as such. 
Sincerely, 
Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P008573-081023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 10, 2023. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Oct. 24, 2023. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #P008573-081023.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: [Records Center] City Records Request :: P008573-081023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
If you wish to submit a response, update an existing request, check the status of an already submitted request, or submit a new public records request, please do so by replying to this notification or go through your “My Request Center” account on the City’s public records request portal 
Good afternoon: 
This is a follow up to my previous correspondence to you regarding your public records request assigned tracking number P008573-081023, and is to also acknowledge receipt of your December 18 correspondence. 
This is to also advise that an installment of records is now available by accessing your account via the My Request Center on the GovQA portal.  The installment is comprised of two Excel spreadsheet reports, generated by staff from the Spokane Police Department. 
Do these documents satisfy the intent of your request?  If they do not and you are seeking additional records from the City, please clarify your request by clearly describing what the remaining identifiable public records are, if any, that you may still be attempting to seek, and we will be glad to look into your request further. 
Please provide any such clarification within 30 days of today's date, or by January 25, 2024.  If no clarification is received from you by that date, your request will be considered concluded and closed, and a new request will be required in this matter after January 25. 2024. 
Sincerely, 
Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk

communications.subject: [Records Center] City Records Request :: P008573-081023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
If you wish to submit a response, update an existing request, check the status of an already submitted request, or submit a new public records request, please do so by replying to this notification or go through your “My Request Center” account on the City’s public records request portal 
Good morning: 
This is a follow up to my December 26, 2023, correspondence to you regarding your public records request assigned tracking number  P008573-081023. 

City Clerk staff processed your request by sending it to department(s) identified by you as the requestor and/or City staff as potentially possessing responsive records.  Records searches of departmental files were conducted to identify responsive records.  Responsive records were then reviewed for possible exempt information. 

In my December 26, 2023, correspondence I sought clarification from you as to whether you were still seeking any records from the City of Spokane, with any such clarification to be received in the City Clerk's Office by January 25, 2024.  Because no clarification was received from you by that date, your request now closed.  See RCW 42/52.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).  All located responsive records have been provided. 

Now that your request is closed, the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address the request. 

If you have any questions about this request, please contact City Clerk’s Office within 10 business days of the date of this message.  See WAC 44-14-04006(1); Cousins v. State, No. 101769-3, 2024 WL 1562882 (Wash. Apr. 11, 2024). 

If we can be of further assistance, please advise. 

Sincerely, 

Laurie Farnsworth 
Spokane Deputy City Clerk
